DisplayName: Total Processor % DPC Time Windows Server 2016 and 1709+
Description: Collects the performance counter Processor\% DPC Time
Notes: The amount of time that a processor spends handling deferred interrupts. High network traffic would normally involve a high DPC time. Use with % interrupt time and Total % to help diagnose processor bottlenecks or application/hardware issues. If total % is high (~85-90%) and % interrupt and % DPC is above ~ 15-25%, probably a performance bottleneck that could be addressed with adding compute. If total % normal/low and % interrupt or % DPC above ~ 15-25% performance issues could be because of hardware, driver, or application related issues.

This monitor runs on a periodic basis (Every Saturday  at 3 a.m. by default) to check the fragmentation levels of all logical drives.  If fragmentation levels are found to be above threshold then by default the state of the monitor will change to "Warning" and an alert will be generated.  There is a recovery named "Logical Disk Defragmentation"  targeted to this monitor, which is disabled by default.  If the recovery is enabled then the state change will automatically kick off a task to defragment the logical drive.
Notes: Only really useful on local HDDs, even then some disks will always have naturally high fragmentation (SQL, Exchange, etc.). Shouldn't be enabled unless you have a need for it.
